fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • In an article (NHS urges social media to ban celebrity ads for ‘health’ products, 2 February, page 3) we said that Bootea, marketed as an aid to detox and losing weight, contained senna, a laxative. To clarify: the product had that ingredient in 2015 when Katie Price promoted it. The version sold in the UK is now senna-free, though the one available in Europe is not. • Other recently corrected articles include: Norway urges students to avoid UK universities in Brexit warning Major western brands pay Indian garment workers 11p an hour Elephant seals take over beach left vacant by US shutdown
